Magazine Show 06 – Teases
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:00:40
	Lorenzo Insigne
	
	This week, Napoli’s Neapolitan idol Lorenzo Insigne.

	
	
	
	

	10:00:47
	Massimiliano Allegri
	
	Massimiliano Allegri’s dream of European glory with I Bianconeri.

	
	
	
	

	10:00:54
	Ronaldinho 
	
	And, a true luminary of the game: the one and only Ronaldinho.

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END




Magazine Show 06 – Kyle Walker
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:01:07
	SOT: KYLE WALKER: (English)
	
	HE’S VERY DETAILED 

	
	
	
	

	10:01:11
	SOT: KYLE WALKER: (English)
	
	HE’S DETAILED IN EVERYTHING HE SAYS. YOU CAN SEE EVERYTHING WE WORK ON IN TRAINING IN THE GAME.

	
	
	
	

	10:01:21
	SOT: KYLE WALKER: (English)
	
	THE GOALS THAT WE SCORED IN PRE-SEASON WERE EXACTLY THE SAME AS WHAT WE’D BEEN DOING IN TRAINING IN THE WEEK PRIOR, AND I WAS LIKE ‘WOW’.

	
	
	
	

	10:01:34
	After SOT
	
	Since joining Manchester City from Tottenham in July, Kyle Walker has flourished in Pep Guardiola’s dynamic team.

	
	
	
	

	10:01:42
	After B-Roll shot
	
	The 27 year-old right-back has impressed in a side that’s scored 30 goals and kept seven clean sheets in their opening ten fixtures in all competitions this season.

	

	
	
	

	10:01:54
	SOT: KYLE WALKER: (English)
	
	WHEN I FIRST KNEW OF THE INTEREST, I DIDN’T REALLY BELIEVE IT I’M MY WORST CRITIC. WE SPOKE AND HE SAID THAT HE WAS VERY INTERESTED; IT GAVE ME A LOT OF CONFIDENCE TO KNOW THAT HE COULD’VE GONE OUT AND BASICALLY GOT ANYONE IN THE WORLD. THERE AREN’T MANY PLAYERS THAT WOULDN’T WANT TO COME AND PLAY FOR HIM AND HE CHOSE ME.




	
	
	
	

	10:02:15
	SOT: KYLE WALKER: (English)
	
	THE CALIBRE OF PLAYER THAT HE’S WORKED WITH FROM PREVIOUS CLUBS: DANI ALVES, PHILIPP LAHM, I THINK THAT SPEAKS VOLUMES. THEY’RE TWO TOTALLY DIFFERENT PLAYERS AS FULL-BACKS, BUT I THOUGHT TO MYSELF, “IF I CAN TAKE A LITTLE BIT FROM EACH OF THEM, IT’S GOING TO HELP ME IMPROVE AS A FULL-BACK.”

	
	
	
	

	10:02:33
	Guardiola pointing
	
	After reaching the Round of 16 in the UEFA Champions League in his first year at the club, Guardiola’s focus ahead of this season was improving the team’s pace, flexibility and quality in wide areas. 

	
	
	
	

	10:02:47
	After B-Roll
	
	Crucial to his plans, as he aims to become just the sixth coach to win the European Cup with different clubs is his theory of breaking the game down into 20 modular sub-pitches. It’s a philosophy that Walker has embraced.

	

	
	
	

	10:03:05
	SOT: KYLE WALKER: (English)


	
	WHAT IS A FORMATION? THERE ARE 11 MEN ON THE FIELD, AND THAT’S IT. WE ALL SPEAK [THE LANGUAGE OF] FOOTBALL AND WE ALL KNOW HOW TO PLAY FOOTBALL, SO HE GIVES US A CLEAR IDEA OF HOW HE WANTS US TO PLAY. IT’S ALL ABOUT TRIANGLES. HE’S A BIG BELIEVER IN THE TRIANGLE. YOU WANT TO CREATE AN OVERLOAD ON THE PITCH IN EVERY POSITION, WHETHER IT’S THREE V TWO OR TWO V ONE.




	

	
	
	

	10:03:26
	SOT: KYLE WALKER: (English)


	
	FOR US AS FULL-BACKS, WE CAN SEE MOST OF THE FIELD BACK THERE. THE FULL-BACK ROLE HAS EVOLVED FROM WHEN I FIRST STARTED PLAYING FULL-BACK TO NOW, AND IT’S ALL ABOUT GETTING UP THE PITCH, CREATING ASSISTS, CREATING CROSSES, CREATING SITUATIONS THAT THE OPPOSITION DOESN’T WANT TO BE INVOLVED IN.

	

	
	
	

	10:03:45
	After SOT
	
	Impressive victories away to Feyenoord on Matchday One, and at home to Shakhtar Donetsk on Matchday Two have seen Manchester City take control of Group F.

	
	
	
	

	10:03:59
	After B-Roll
	
	Next they face back-to-back games with Napoli, as Pep Guardiola’s Manchester City continue their evolution in what is the club’s seventh season competing in the UEFA Champions League.

	

	
	
	

	
10:04:10
	SOT: KYLE WALKER: (English)
	
	I’M LEARNING EVERY DAY WITH THE TYPE OF PLAYERS THAT WE’VE GOT AND ESPECIALLY FROM THE MANAGER.

	

	
	
	

	
10:04:17
	SOT: KYLE WALKER: (English)


	
	IF YOU GET A GOOD CHEMISTRY IN THE TEAM WHICH I THINK WE’VE GOT NOW, AND A GOOD UNDERSTANDING OF THE PLAYERS AROUND YOU, YOU’RE GOING TO DO WELL NO MATTER WHAT TEAM YOU ARE.




	
	
	
	

	10:04:28
	SOT: KYLE WALKER: (English)
	
	YOU HAVE TO TRUST YOUR TEAM-MATES FIRST AND FOREMOST ON THE PITCH. YOU HAVE TO KNOW THAT WE’VE ALL GOT EACH OTHER’S BACKS THROUGH THICK AND THIN, AND I THINK THAT’S WHAT HOPEFULLY HE’S GOING TO BUILD ON THIS SEASON: THAT WE’RE ALL THERE FOR EACH OTHER, ALL PUSHING EACH OTHER AND ANYONE WHO FALLS BELOW THE STANDARD THAT WE’VE SHOWN IN THE LAST COUPLE OF GAMES, IT’S NOT ACCEPTABLE.

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END




Magazine Show 06 – Lorenzo Insigne
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:04:57
	SOT: LORENZO INSIGNE (ITALIAN)

	
	I’M PROUD TO WEAR THIS SHIRT ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD BECAUSE JUST LIKE EVERY OTHER NEAPOLITAN CHILD, MY DREAM WAS TO PLAY FOR THIS TEAM, IN THIS STADIUM.

	
	
	
	

	10:05:10
	SOT: LORENZO INSIGNE (ITALIAN)
	
	I WAS A CHILD WHEN NAPOLI WERE IN SERIE C AND I REMEMBER THERE WERE 70,000 OR 80,000 FANS SUPPORTING THE TEAM.

	
	
	
	

	10:05:20
	SOT: LORENZO INSIGNE (ITALIAN)

	
	I’VE EVEN TALKED TO MY TEAMMATES AND TRIED TO LET THEM KNOW WHAT NAPOLI MEANS TO THE PEOPLE IN THIS CITY. THIS IS A PASSION WHICH IS MUCH MORE THAN JUST CHEERING THE TEAM.

	
	
	
	

	10:05:35
	SOT: COMMENTARY (ITALIAN)
	
	[Pause for commentary]

	
	
	
	

	10:05:38
	After Comms


	
	The only Neapolitan in the Napoli team, Lorenzo Insigne was born and raised less than 20 kilometers from the Stadio San Paolo in the district of Frattamaggiore - where he grew up, like his three brothers, obsessed with the ball.

	
	
	
	

	10:05:58
	SOT: LORENZO INSIGNE (ITALIAN)
	
	WHEN I WAS A CHILD, I WENT FOR TRIALS AT MANY CLUBS. I DIDN’T MAKE THE GRADE, NOT BECAUSE I DIDN’T PLAY WELL BUT DUE TO THE FACT THAT I WAS TOO SHORT AND WEAK ACCORDING TO THOSE WHO ASSESSED ME. I WASN’T GOOD ENOUGH FOR THEM AND I CONSIDERED QUITTING FOOTBALL. THEN I HAD A TRIAL AT NAPOLI AND BEGAN TO PLAY FOR THIS CLUB.

	
	
	
	

	10:06:32
	After SOT
	
	After joining the club’s academy aged fifteen, Insigne made his Napoli debut in 2010; but it was only after impressive loan spells with Foggia and Pescara – where he scored thirty-seven league goals in two seasons – that he truly earned the adulation of Napoli’s famous support. 

	
	
	
	

	10:06:51
	SOT: LORENZO INSIGNE (ITALIAN)
	
	ANY PLAYER WHO PLAYS FOR HIS CITY’S TEAM EXPERIENCES PROBLEMS WITH THE FANS, SOONER OR LATER. IT’S NORMAL THAT THEY THINK THAT I MUST ALWAYS PERFORM BETTER THAN MY TEAMMATES, BECAUSE I’M FROM NAPLES.

	
	
	
	

	10:07:04
	After SOT
	
	A forward of pace and superb technical ability, Insigne marked his UEFA Champions League debut with the decisive goal against Borussia Dortmund in 2013. Last season was his most impressive: he scored 20 goals in all competitions, including a memorable strike in a Round of 16 clash at Real Madrid.

	
	
	
	

	10:07:27
	SOT: COMMENTARY (ITALIAN)
	
	[Pause for commentary]

	
	
	
	

	10:07:33
	SOT: LORENZO INSIGNE (ITALIAN)
	
	FOR A GUY FROM NAPLES PLAYING FOR NAPOLI IN THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE, SCORING AT THE BERNABÉU JUST DOESN’T HAPPEN EVERY YEAR.
I HOPE THAT SOME OTHER PLAYERS FROM NAPLES CAN MAKE THEIR DREAMS COME TRUE JUST LIKE ME. THESE ARE DREAMS WE ALL HAVE WHEN WE ARE KIDS.




	
	
	
	

	10:07:53
	After SOT
	
	Ahead of a trip to England to face Pep Guardiola’s in-form Manchester City on Matchday Three, Italian league leaders Napoli have seven wins from seven; and in Lorenzo Insigne, they boast a player who struck four goals, and made five assists, already this season.

	
	
	
	

	10:08:12
	SOT: LORENZO INSIGNE (ITALIAN)
	
	WE CAN’T BE SCARED WHEN WE TAKE TO THE PITCH. WE KNOW MANCHESTER CITY HAVE SOME FANTASTIC PLAYERS, BUT IF WE PLAY AS A TEAM AS WE KNOW WE CAN, WE CAN GIVE THEM A HARD TIME. WE HAVE THE RIGHT QUALITIES; WE JUST HAVE TO BELIEVE IN OURSELVES. I THINK THIS IS AN INCREDIBLE COMPETITION THAT EVERY FOOTBALLER WANTS TO TAKE PART IN. I HOPE TO KEEP PLAYING IN IT FOR MANY YEARS TO COME.

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END




Magazine Show 06 - Jasmin Handanović
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:08:57
	SOT: JASMIN HANDANOVIĆ (SLOVENIAN)

	
	I FEEL VERY PASSIONATE ABOUT MARIBOR. WHEN YOU PLAY FOR MARIBOR YOU HAVE TO DO SO WITH GREAT ENTHUSIASM. THE CITY, THE PEOPLE AND THE FIERY TEMPERAMENT OF THE PLACE MEANS A LOT TO ME.

	
	
	
	

	10:09:15
	After SOT
	
	Jasmin Handanović has made over 200 appearances for Maribor, winning five league titles and three domestic cups, since joining the club from Italian side Empoli in 2011. A cousin of Internazionale goalkeeper Samir Handanović, Jasmin experienced UEFA Champions League football for the first time at the age of 36, and is now – at 39 – the joint oldest player in the competition, alongside Gianluigi Buffon.

	
	
	
	

	10:09:45
	SOT: JASMIN HANDANOVIĆ (SLOVENIAN)

	
	IN LIFE, THINGS JUST FALL INTO PLACE IF YOU ARE IN THE RIGHT PLACE AT THE RIGHT TIME AND THAT’S HOW IT’S WORKED OUT FOR ME WITH MARIBOR. I’M VERY HAPPY ABOUT THAT AND I FEEL I’VE PROVED THAT IT’S NEVER TOO LATE, IF YOU JUST KEEP BELIEVING.

	
	
	
	

	10:10:01
	After SOT
	
	It was in 2014, that Handanović’s clean sheet in a Play-Off second leg at Celtic Park secured Maribor’s return to Europe’s premier club competition after a 15 year absence.




	
	
	
	

	10:10:16
	
	
	During the Group Stage the Slovenian champions drew with all three of their opponents, including José Mourinho’s Chelsea in a memorable encounter, in which Handanović saved a late penalty from Eden Hazard.

	
	
	
	

	10:10:31
	SOT: JASMIN HANDANOVIĆ (SLOVENIAN)

	
	WE STILL CHERISH THESE MEMORIES, AND THEY ARE VERY MUCH ALIVE AND SPECIAL TO US, BUT ONCE IT’S ALL DIED DOWN YOU JUST WANT MORE SUCCESS. I HOPE WE CAN ACHIEVE THIS IN THIS YEAR’S CHAMPIONS LEAGUE.

	
	
	
	

	10:10:45
	After SOT

	
	On their return to the competition, Maribor are currently bottom of Group E with a point from two matches. A one all draw at home to Spartak Moscow, was followed by a 3-0 defeat at Sevilla on Matchday Two.

	
	
	
	

	10:11:04
	SOT: JASMIN HANDANOVIĆ (SLOVENIAN)

	
	IN THE CASE OF THE SPARTAK [MOSCOW] GAME, WE EXPECTED TO WIN, BUT CONSIDERING WHAT THE FINAL SCORE WAS AND HOW THE MATCH PLAYED OUT, WE’RE HAPPY THAT WE GOT A POINT. THE SECOND MATCH WAS IN SEVILLE, IT WAS HOT THERE AND THEY WERE SIMPLY TOO STRONG FOR US THIS TIME.

	
	
	
	

	10:11:25
	After SOT
	
	Next, Maribor face five time European champions Liverpool at home, with both sides seeking their first win in Group E; and Maribor dreaming of a first Group Stage victory since 1999.




	

	
	
	

	10:11:41
	SOT: JASMIN HANDANOVIĆ (SLOVENIAN)

	
	WE CAN EXPECT LIVERPOOL TO PERFORM AS THEY USUALLY DO - EXTREMELY AGGRESSIVELY, ATTACK-MINDED AND WITH PACE - WHICH WE MUST SUPPRESS BY BEING STRONG IN DEFENCE, AND THEN TAKING ADVANTAGE OF THEM ON THE COUNTER ATTACK. WE’RE REALLY EXCITED AND I HOPE WE GET A GOOD RESULT.

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END






Magazine Show 06 - Still to come
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:12:10
	Qarabağ

	
	Still to come, Qarabağ’s remarkable adventure writing history in the UEFA Champions League.

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END




Magazine Show 06 – Massimiliano Allegri
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:13:11
	SOT: MASSIMILIANO ALLEGRI (ITALIAN)
	
	WINNING THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE ISN’T A TARGET, IT’S A DREAM. IN ORDER TO MAKE THAT DREAM COME TRUE YOU HAVE TO WORK OVER SEVERAL YEARS AND ABOVE ALL DEVELOP A CERTAIN MINDSET.

	
	
	
	

	10:13:24
	SOT: MASSIMILIANO ALLEGRI (ITALIAN)
	
	YOU NEED A LOT OF HARD WORK AT BOARD LEVEL AND IN TERMS OF COACHING. ABOVE ALL YOU NEED TO PLAN, BRING IN QUALITY PLAYERS AND EVOLVE. I THINK AS A CLUB WE ARE DOING OF ALL THAT TO THE BEST OF OUR ABILITY.

	
	
	
	

	10:13:41
	After SOT
	
	Since taking charge of Juventus in 2014, Massimiliano Allegri has led the club to three league titles, three Italian cups and two UEFA Champions League finals. In Berlin, in 2015, I Bianconeri were defeated 3-1 by Barcelona.

	
	
	
	

	10:14:00
	2017 Final
	
	In Cardiff, in June, they were beaten finalists for a seventh time, losing 4-1 to Real Madrid. 

	
	
	
	

	10:14:09
	SOT: MASSIMILIANO ALLEGRI (ITALIAN)
	
	THE LAST THREE YEARS HAVE BEEN FANTASTIC, REACHING TWO CHAMPIONS LEAGUE FINALS. THE FIRST WAS UNEXPECTED, BUT WE WENT INTO THE SECOND FINAL WITH MORE HOPE. WE DIDN’T WIN IT, BUT WE STILL REGARD AS A SUCCESS - IT’S NOT OFTEN YOU GET TO BE INVOLVED IN A CHAMPIONS LEAGUE FINAL IN YOUR LIFETIME.




	
	
	
	

	10:14:27
	After SOT
	
	For Gianluigi Buffon, three times a finalist, victory in the UEFA Champions League remains elusive. On Matchday Two, the 39 year old – now into the final year of his Juventus contract – set an Italian record by making his 110th competition appearance. 

	
	
	
	

	10:14:46
	SOT: MASSIMILIANO ALLEGRI (ITALIAN)
	
	IN MY OPINION, HE’S STILL GOT GREAT ENTHUSIASM FOR THE GAME, LIKE A YOUNG KID. HE’S GOT A HEALTHY DOSE OF CRAZINESS AND A GOOD CONSCIENCE. HE’S SPECIAL BECAUSE HE’S BEEN THE BEST GOALKEEPER IN THE WORLD FOR THE LAST 20 YEARS.

	
	
	
	

	10:15:03
	MD2 Goals
	
	After defeat at Barcelona on Matchday One, Juve’s 2-0 victory at home to Olympiacos put them on three points in Group D - level with Sporting Clube de Portugal, who they face for the first time, next.

	
	
	
	

	10:15:19
	SOT: MASSIMILIANO ALLEGRI (ITALIAN)
	
	IT’S A BALANCED GROUP, MORE BALANCED THAN IT SEEMS. ASIDE FROM BARCELONA, SPORTING AND OLYMPIACOS ARE EXPERIENCED SIDES IN EUROPE.  

	
	
	
	

	10:15:29
	Massimiliano Allegri
	
	Massimiliano Allegri has reached the UEFA Champions League Knockout Phase in each of his seven seasons as a coach in the competition. His ambition now, is to become just the third man to lead Juventus to European glory.




	

	
	
	

	10:15:45
	SOT: MASSIMILIANO ALLEGRI (ITALIAN)
	
	JUVENTUS’ AIM IS TO BE A CONSISTENT FIXTURE AMONG EUROPE’S TOP EIGHT CLUBS. YOU JUST NEED TO WORK HARD, BE DRIVEN AND MOTIVATED. ULTIMATELY, BEING MOTIVATED IS WHAT MAKES THE DIFFERENCE.

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END


































Magazine Show 06 - Qarabağ
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:16:05
	SOT: GURBAN GURBANOV (AZERI)
	
	WE ARE PROUD TO REPRESENT AZERBAIJAN IN THE UEFA CHAMPIONS LEAGUE. WE ARE A SMALL FOOTBALLING NATION AND THIS IS A FIRST STEP FOR US IN SUCH A COMPETITION. 

	
	
	
	

	10:16:19
	After SOT

	
	The journey of Qarabağ in this season’s UEFA Champions League has already been an historic one for everyone connected with the club. When they faced Roma in Baku on Matchday Two, it was the first ever Champions League Group Stage game to take place in Azerbaijan.

	
	
	
	

	10:16:45
	SOT: RASHAD SADYGOV (AZERI)

	
	CHILDREN, WOMEN, THE ELDERLY - EVERYONE HAS BEEN TALKING ABOUT FOOTBALL, THEY’RE ALL DISCUSSING OUR GAMES IN THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE.

	
	
	
	

	10:16:55
	SOT: GURBAN GURBANOV (AZERI) 

	
	FROM THE FIRST MINUTE OF THE GAME WE FELT ROMA’S STRENGTH AND WE CONCEDED TWO GOALS. BUT DESPITE THAT, THE PLAYERS STILL TRIED TO TAKE THE GAME TO ROMA AND THEY FOUGHT RIGHT UNTIL THE END OF THE MATCH.

	
	
	
	

	10:17:24
	SOT: RASHAD SADYGOV (AZERI)

	
	IN THE END WE LOST 2-1. WE WANTED AT LEAST A POINT FROM THE GAME, BUT IT JUST DIDN’T HAPPEN.




	
	
	
	

	10:17:36
	After SOT

	
	Qarabağ originate from Agdam in the west of Azerbaijan, almost 300 kilometres from Baku. But due to a conflict in their region, they were forced to relocate to the country’s capital in 1993, the same year they won their first league title. Twenty-one years after that move, the club won their second league championship and have now been champions of Azerbaijan for four consecutive seasons.

	
	
	
	

	10:18:08
	SOT: GURBAN GURBANOV (AZERI)

	
	I WOULD LIKE TO THANK OUR FANS FOR NOT LETTING US BE ALONE IN BAKU, THEY’RE ALWAYS WITH US. ALL AZERBAIJANI FANS ARE SUPPORTING QARABAĞ. OUR AIM IS TO PLAY GOOD FOOTBALL AGAINST ALL OF OUR OPPONENTS SO THAT OUR SUPPORTERS CAN BE PROUD OF OUR FIGHTING SPIRIT, SO THEY CAN SEE THAT WE’RE NOT SATISFIED WITH JUST REACHING THE CHAMPIONS LEAGUE GROUP STAGE.

	
	
	
	

	10:18:40
	After SOT 
	
	Under the guidance of coach Gurban Gurbanov, Azerbaijan’s record international goalscorer who’s been in charge since 2008, Qarabağ have conceded eight goals in their defeats to Chelsea and Roma. Their education on the European stage will continue against Atlético Madrid.

	
	
	
	

	10:18:59
	SOT: RASHAD SADYGOV (AZERI)

	
	OUR SQUAD WAS ASSEMBLED BY OUR HEAD COACH AND WE PLAY ACCORDING TO HIS PHILOSOPHY. HE’S VERY HUMBLE, KIND AND HONEST AND OUR SQUAD IS BUILT UPON SUCH QUALITIES.




	

	
	
	

	10:19:17
	SOT: GURBAN GURBANOV (AZERI)

	
	OUR PLAYERS NOW UNDERSTAND THE MEANING OF “GREAT FOOTBALL” - AND I THINK FOR THE YEARS AHEAD THIS IS AN INCREDIBLE OPPORTUNITY FOR BOTH THE PLAYERS AND THE CLUB TO DEVELOP. 

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END





Magazine Show 06 – Ronaldinho
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:19:41
	SOT: RONALDINHO GAÚCHO (Portuguese)
	
	I HAVE ALWAYS HAD A VERY CLEAR IDEA OF WHAT I WANTED IN MY MIND. I WAS GIVEN THE GIFT OF PLAYING FOOTBALL, WHICH IS WHAT I LOVE MOST, SO I HAVE ALWAYS TRIED TO ENJOY IT TO THE MAXIMUM. 

	
	
	
	

	10:19:57
	After SOT
	
	Few players are as universally adored as Ronaldinho Gaúcho. A player who made the game seem effortless, he was a true master of the ball. 

	
	
	
	

	10:20:13
	On first smile ISO
	
	His smile is one of football’s most iconic images. A smile that reflected the love he held for a sport he played so beautifully.

	
	
	
	

	10:20:25
	SOT: RONALDINHO GAÚCHO (Portuguese)
	
	FOOTBALL HAS ALWAYS BEEN WITH ME EVER SINCE I WAS A CHILD. I CAME FROM A FAMILY OF FOOTBALL PLAYERS, SO MY WHOLE LIFE REVOLVED AROUND FOOTBALL. IT HAS ALWAYS BEEN MY LIFE. 

	
	
	
	

	10:20:40
	After SOT
	
	Born in Porto Alegre, Ronaldinho used the streets, the beaches and futsal to develop his artistry of the game. 

	
	
	
	

	10:20:49
	On football  pitch
	
	After three years flourishing with Grêmio a move to Europe was inevitable for Brazil’s most promising young talent.

	
	
	
	

	10:21:00
	On Eiffel Tower shot
	
	And it was during two seasons with Paris Saint Germain that he lifted the World Cup with the Seleção in 2002.




	
	
	
	

	10:21:11
	
	Arriving at Barcelona
	
	A year later, and a move to Barcelona finally gave Ronaldinho the opportunity to exhibit his exhilarating style on European football’s biggest club stage.  

	
	
	
	

	10:21:27
	SOT: RONALDINHO GAÚCHO (Portuguese)
	
	PLAYERS OF MY AGE DREAMED OF PLAYING FOR BARCELONA. I CERTAINLY DID AS MY IDOLS HAD PLAYED FOR THEM: RONALDO, RIVALDO, ROMÁRIO. WE TRY TO FOLLOW THE PATH AS OUR IDOLS. MORE THAN JUST BRINGING ME JOY, PLAYING FOR BARCELONA WAS THE FULFILMENT OF MY BIGGEST DREAM.

	
	
	
	

	10:21:49
	After SOT


	
	There were times at Barcelona, when Ronaldinho was unplayable, re-inventing the game with his touch and technique. He was the complete player, at the peak of his powers; the world watched in awe.

	
	
	
	

	10:22:07
	On Ronaldinho close up
	
	And in 2006, he led Barcelona to glory in the UEFA Champions League, ending the club’s 14 year wait to be European champions again. 

	
	
	
	

	10:22:20
	SOT: RONALDINHO GAÚCHO (Portuguese)
	
	IT WAS FANTASTIC. I HAVE GREAT MEMORIES OF THE WHOLE MATCH. FEW PLAYERS HAVE THE PRIVILEGE OF PLAYING IN A CHAMPIONS LEAGUE FINAL, LET ALONE WINNING ONE. I REMEMBER EVERYTHING. IT WAS VERY SPECIAL.

	
	
	
	

	10:22:43
	SOT: RONALDINHO GAÚCHO (Portuguese)
	
	IT HAD BEEN MANY YEARS SINCE BARCELONA HAD WON THAT TROPHY. THEREFORE, I THINKMY TEAMMATES AND I HAVE GONE DOWN IN THE CLUB’S HISTORY BECAUSE WE BLAZED THE TRAIL FOR A GLORIOUS NEW GENERATION AT BARCELONA. 

	
	
	
	

	10:23:04
	After SOT
	
	Ronaldinho was an inspiration at Barcelona, and his impact at the club still reverberates today. In 2008 he moved on joining AC Milan, where he spent two seasons among the elite of European football. 

	
	
	
	

	10:23:24
	On Rio timelapse

	
	In 2015, back in his homeland, Ronaldinho retired from the game. Bringing to a close an extraordinary career played with joyful abandon.  

	
	
	
	

	10:23:38
	SOT: RONALDINHO GAÚCHO (Portuguese)
	
	I FEEL BLESSED BECAUSE I’VE HAD THE PRIVILEGE OF MEETING MY IDOLS, AND EVEN PLAYING WITH SOME OF THEM. I WAS VERY LUCKY DURING MY CAREER. I PLAYED AT GREAT CLUBS WITH GREAT PLAYERS. I TRIED TO ENJOY IT AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE, ALL THE TIME.

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END




Magazine Show 06 - Lookahead
	TIME
	PICTURE:SOUND
	
	COMMENTARY

	
	
	
	

	10:24:01
	Luka Modrić 
	
	Next week, the journey of Real Madrid’s outstanding Croatian midfielder Luka Modrić. 

	
	
	
	

	
	
	
	END

data.title: Mettre en scène la révolution
data.summary: Pendant plus de septante ans (de 1918 à 1990), l'acte fondateur du régime soviétique, "la Grande Révolution Socialiste d'Octobre", se commémore et se donne à voir sous la forme d'un spectacle grandiose lors du 7 novembre, permettant au pouvoir soviétique de se mettre en scène. D'abord organisées sous la forme d'une parade militaire et populaire, les commémorations d'Octobre sont aussi à l'origine d'une immense production iconographique, allant des banderoles aux films en passant par les affiches, les photographies, les tableaux, la vaisselle de porcelaine, les cartes postales, les timbres, les médailles, les documentaires filmés, la musique ou encore les monuments. Dans "Spectacle de la révolution", dix-sept spécialistes de l'histoire de l'Union Soviétique et de culture visuelle décortiquent les aspects les plus connus, mais aussi ceux dont l'importance a longtemps été ignorée. A lire: le collectif "Le spectacle de la Révolution - La culture visuelle des commémorations d'Octobre", Gianni Haver, Jean-François Fayet, Valérie Gorin, Emilia Koustova et autres contributions (Ed. Antipodes, 2017).

Pendant plus de septante ans (de 1918 à 1990), lʹacte fondateur du régime soviétique, "la Grande Révolution Socialiste dʹOctobre", se commémore et se donne à voir sous la forme dʹun spectacle grandiose lors du 7 novembre, permettant au pouvoir soviétique de se mettre en scène. Dʹabord organisées sous la forme dʹune parade militaire et populaire, les commémorations dʹOctobre sont aussi à lʹorigine dʹune immense production iconographique, allant des banderoles aux films en passant par les affiches, les photographies, les tableaux, la vaisselle de porcelaine, les cartes postales, les timbres, les médailles, les documentaires filmés, la musique ou encore les monuments. Dans "Spectacle de la révolution", dix-sept spécialistes de lʹhistoire de lʹUnion Soviétique et de culture visuelle décortiquent les aspects les plus connus, mais aussi ceux dont lʹimportance a longtemps été ignorée.
Avec en direct Gianni Haver, professeur associé de sociologie de l'image à l'Institut de sociologie des communications de masse à l'Université de Lausanne.
A lire: le collectif "Le spectacle de la Révolution - La culture visuelle des commémorations d'Octobre", Gianni Haver, Jean-François Fayet, Valérie Gorin, Emilia Koustova et autres contributions, éditions Antipodes

data.title: L'invité-e d'actualité : Bruno Strasser revient sur l'attribution du prix Nobel de chimie au Vaudois Jacques Dubochet
data.summary:
Bruno Strasser, historien des sciences et professeur à l'Université de Genève, revient sur le parcours de Jacques Dubochet, qui a reçu le prix Nobel de chimie et sur l'impact qu'une telle récompense peut avoir pour un chercheur et une Université.

* * Bruno Strasser revient sur l'attribution du prix Nobel de chimie au Vaudois Jacques Dubochet  Bruno Strasser ** 09) vient à 7h au studio de Genève. 
***7h18 
Réseaux sociaux, médias... On le voit partout depuis hier... 
Le Vaudois Jacques Dubochet a reçu le prix Nobel de chimie.. en même temps que deux de ses confrères... 
Les scientifiques ont été récompensés pour leurs travaux en cryo-microscopie électronique... 
Bruno Strasser, bonjour... 
Vous êtes historien des sciences, professeur à l'Université de Genève...
on va aborder avec vous... l'impact qu'une telle récompense peut avoir pour un chercheur et une Université - celle de Lausanne en l'occurrence - ... 
Mais un mot peut-être sur Jaques Dubochet.. 
La plupart des Romands l'on connu hier... 
Vous vous le connaissez personnellement... son profil atypique a immédiatement séduit toute la Suisse romande... 
Vous comprenez l'engouement pour le personnage?
(physicien de formation, formé à l'EPUL, comme bcp de physiciens de l'époque s'est converti à la biologie, via la technique, l'instrumentation.. la cryo-microscopie électronique. ..que d'autres ont ensuite utilisé - parcours similaire à un autre prix Nobel suisse Werner Arber
(ancien 68ard, très engagé dans la relation entre Sciences et société à l'Uni de LA, membre du PS..Membre du conseil communal de Morges. N'a pas voulu être en direct dans le 19.30, pour ne pas rater sa séance!)
*** L'Université de Lausanne a son premier prix Nobel... qu'est-ce que ça va lui apporter, en plus du prestige?
(augmente son ranking (Shangai inclut les prix Nobels) - chercheurs davantages enclins à postuler pour UNIL , plus facile d'obtenir crédits ou collaborations, attribution d'un Pôle national de recherche etc.  - très important pour petite université, plus que pour grande institution - régionalement, fortifie l'UNIL face au poids lourd EPFL!...)
***Et quelles seront les retombées de ce prix  pour Jacques Dubochet lui-même? ll arrive trente ans après ses travaux.. alors qu'il est à la retraite.. ce n'est pas trop tard?
(prix récompense une technologie essentielle à la recherche... il a fallu du temps pour montrer son utilité... explique peut-être ce délai... mais Prix Nobel = loterie, quelques centaines de scientifiques le méritent)
***dès qu'il a reçu son prix, il l'a attribué à tout une équipe... la recherche scientifique c'est rarement le fait d'un seul homme?
(Prix N. renforce image du scientifique qui travaille seul, culture de star.. masi c'est un cliché, dans réalité, la valeur d'un chercheur dépend entièrement des autres et de ses concurrents)
***On sait que le milieu de la recherche est extrêment compétitf... énorme pression sur les chercheurs pour être publiés... Un tel prix, c'est le Graal dans la carrière de quelques scientifiques... mais ne représente en rien la réalité de milliers de chercheurs...
***Est-ce qu'on peut imaginer des répercussions à long terme? Un engouement pour la matière des écoliers, des étudiants? 
((c'est ce que dit Daniel Saraga, red ched de Horizons dans le TF de Katja))
*** Et pour la Suisse... c'est une bonne nouvelle bien sûr, mais concrètement, quels avantages?
(Strasser est plutôt sceptique: un Prix Nobel aide à la compétition mais ne change pas la face du monde... domaine primé très étroit, et la réputation ne fait pas tout - mais renforce position de la CH pour grands projets européens... être pleinement incluse dans mécanisme européen de financement de la science)
*****
.. et vous connaissez personnellement Jacques Dubochet..  Pour commencer parlez-nous de son parcours... pour un Prix Nobel de chimie... il est plutôt atypique? 
(physicien de formation, formé à l'EPUL, comme bcp de physiciens de l'époque s'est converti à la biologie, via la technique, l'instrumentation.. la cryo-microscopie électronique. ..que d'autres ont ensuite utilisé - parcours similaire à un autre prix Nobel suisse Werner Arber)
- et sur le plan de la personnalité.. ce n'est pas vraiment le scientifique dans sa tour d'ivoire?
(ancien 68ard, très engagé dans la relation entre Sciences et société à l'Uni de LA, membre du PS..)

data.title: L'invité du 12h30 : L'invité du 12h30 - Guillaume Poix publie "Les fils conducteurs"
data.summary:
Participants hors thésaurus : David Lopez, écrivain
Guillaume Poix est comédien, metteur en scène et dramaturge. Il signe son premier roman "Les fils conducteurs" (éditions Verticales, Gallimard) dans lequel on découvre une langue imaginaire.

* * L'invité du 12h30 - Guillaume Poix publie "Les fils conducteurs" (* INVITE GUILLAUME POIX) Le 12h30 qui s'intéresse toute la semaine au premier roman. 
La rentrée littéraire en compte 81.. 
On a voulu savoir comment s'écrit et se décide un premier roman. pourquoi un roman ? Sur quel sujet ? avec quel langage ? Une langue qui se réinvente en tout cas.. 
On a pu le constater notamment .. hier.. avec David Lopez.. l'auteur de fief.. ce fief.. une zone qui a son propre langage.. du wesh.. un parlé qui fait son entrée en littérature.. 
Lundi..  Emmanuel Brault.. inventait des mots.. qui sortait de la bouche de son narrateur des « Peaux rouges ».. un raciste viscéral qui parle faux.. et mal.. 
Aujourd'hui, l'invité primo-romancier.. vient du théâtre.. il est comédien.. metteur en scène.. et dramaturge. Guillaume Poix.. signe « les fils conducteurs ».. aux éditions Verticales de la maison Gallimard.. Et dans ce roman.. on y découvre une langue imaginaire.. 
Bonjour Guillaume Poix !
C'est intéressant de constater.. à travers les exemples.. que je viens de citer.. cette richesse dans l'écriture.. d'une langue qui continue de se réinventer. qu'êtes-vous allé chercher dans le roman que vous ne trouviez pas dans le théâtre ?
Avec la littérature.. pas de spectateur mais un lecteur.. silencieux..ça aussi.. c'était une volonté de votre part ? avec quelles attentes ?
Vous emmenez le lecteur..sur une décharge gigantesque. A Accra .. au Ghana.. un cimetière numérique.. où s'entassent tous nos objets électroniques .. qu'on a remplacés.. c'est l'enfer sur terre.. conséquence d'un mal provoqué par la société de consommation. « l'obsolescence programmé »..
Ce lieu vous l'avez découvert à travers une photo.. à quel moment vous êtes vous dit que vous en feriez votre premier roman ?
A propos de photos et d'image.. l'invité d'hier David Lopez.. que vous avez d'ailleurs déjà rencontré.. voulait vous demander ceci.. on écoute sa question. 
MAG
Cette décharge existe.. mais vous ne souhaitiez pas vous rendre sur place.. en quoi la voir en vrai aurait limité votre écriture ?
..   
Et sur cette décharge. vous inventez une langue. celle des enfants qui fouillent les objets .. les ordures métalliques..  pour y trouver des composants.. ces fils conducteurs.. qui leur permettent de survivre.. 
Cette langue qui colle.. qui occupe toutes les pores de ces jeunes garçons intoxiqués par les émanations dangereuses des composants électroniques.  Jacob.. ce petit garçon de 11 ans.. nouveau venu sur place..sa mère ne le comprend plus..
Je précise que ce lieu.. porte un nom qui aurait pu être inventé.. « ag-bog-bloshie ». pour l'apprivoiser.. il faut déjà l'écrire juste.. AG-BLOG-BLOSHIE. ce lieu existe..il suffit de taper ce mot sur un moteur de reccerche .
Il faut savoir.. que la première scène de votre roman.. ne se tient pas sur une décharge au Ghana.. mais à Genève..  c'est là que vit Thomas.. un photographe franco suisse.. .. quelle place a occupé la suisse dans l'écriture de votre livre ?
Mais le début de votre livre c'est de la pure fiction.. puisque Vous imaginez un oui des genevois au projet de rénovation du musée d'art et d'histoire..  « une victoire historique pour la culture et l'environnement ».. ironie de l'histoire..  c'est bien le non qui l'a emporté en février 2016.. ce vote vous avait marqué ? 
J'ai lu que vous avez entamé l'écriture d'une 2ème livre.. autour de l'ONU. c'est Genève.qui continue de vous inspirer ?
Demain. le 12h30 reçoit un auteur suisse Thomas Flahaut,.. qui publie son premier roman « Ostwald » qui a lui aussi choisi comme un décor de chaos.. il imagine un grave incident à la centrale nucléaire de Fessenheim..  quelle question souhaitez vous lui poser ?
On entendra sa réponse demain ! 
Merci Guillaume Poix d'avoir accepté l'invitation du 12h30.. votre premier roman.. s'intitule les « fils conducteurs ».. c'est aux éditions verticales de la maison Gallimard..
